intro: Stephania praelata, commonly known as the white angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its striking, funnel-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
